{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3150478,"name":null,"username":"shush","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/aeb1de/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-22T14:16:04.317Z","cooked":"

The title says it, sensors disconnect sometimes, and with other types of sensors I managed to make the code continue running until they connect again; but with this one, I don’t see how. It says “could not find REV Color Sensor” and the code crashes. Does anyone know of a way to make it… not crash?
Thanks!

What language are you using? Can you share your code (ideally as a link to github or similar)?

Nevermind, it randomly worked now and I can’t recreate it, I’m so confused. But hey, there isn’t an error now…

The color sensor is connected to MXP I2C through the NavX. We’re using Java, and just creating the color sensor object and sending some of it’s measurements to the Shuffleboard.

Now, when the sensor is disconnected, it just shows default values in the shuffleboard, when previously would crash. I didn’t change any code, just connected and disconnected it a few times to see what happens.

Glad it’s working now. In the future, if code crashes, definitely save a copy of the stacktrace. It’ll tell you exactly where it’s failing and (in many cases) why. If nothing else, it’ll be useful information to share when asking for help.
